title: Manchester United 0-1 Everton: Premier League – live reaction
summary: David Moyes makes a return to Old Trafford as his team, Everton, faces Manchester United. The match is being covered with a minute-by-minute report by Michael Butler. Fans are eager to see how Moyes' tactics will play out against his former club.

title: Trump signs exectuive order designating Muslim Brotherhood chapters ‘Foreign Terrorist Organizations’ – live
summary: Laura Loomer, a far-right influencer, is reviving demands for the administration to arrest prominent Muslim Democrats, alleging without evidence that they are linked to a specific organization. Her assertions continue to fuel controversy and debate surrounding political rhetoric and accountability. Loomer's claims highlight ongoing tensions within U.S. politics regarding race and religion.

title: Everton brush off bizarre Gueye red card to beat lethargic Manchester United
summary: Manchester United suffered a disappointing 1-0 loss to Everton, even after the home team was reduced to 10 players following Idrissa Gueye's red card for slapping Michael Keane. The defeat highlights United's ongoing struggles this season. Everton capitalized on their numerical advantage, securing a crucial win.

title: US justice department renews request to unseal Epstein grand jury materials
summary: The Department of Justice (DoJ) contends that recent congressional action to release the Epstein files justifies the unsealing of related court records. This suggests a shift in access to sensitive information linked to high-profile cases. The move could have significant implications for ongoing investigations and legal proceedings.
